components.label: HTML
components.content: Read about the restrictions and how you can resolve them.

components.title: Code B3D - B.C. loan in default
components.label: Panel

components.html: Your B.C. loan is in default and has been transferred to the Revenue Services of British Columbia for further collection activity. You are restricted from further StudentAid BC funding. Please contact Revenue Services of British Columbia immediately before your credit rating is further impacted: 1-866-361-5050 (Toll free within North America) or 250-387-6093 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html:
According to the information on file, you have declared bankruptcy involving student loans. As your bankruptcy involves student loans, you are not eligible for funding through StudentAid BC and your application is currently restricted.

If you have declared bankruptcy in which Canada student loan or British Columbia student loan funds were involved, you cease to be eligible for both federal and provincial assistance. You may be considered for further student financial assistance if federal and/or provincial authorities approve of the steps taken to meet rehabilitation criteria on your outstanding debt(s). For further information regarding rehabilitation with respect to Canada student loan funds, please contact the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program at 1-888-815-4514 to speak with a Case Review Officer. For further information regarding rehabilitation with respect to BC student loan funds, please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html: We have been advised that you completed your part-time program of study early. Therefore, the change in your study period end date has been recorded at StudentAid BC. For further information please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html: Your account is restricted from future part-time funding due to poor scholastic standing. You are no longer eligible to receive student financial assistance. Students who have not successfully completed courses funded through student financial assistance may be reinstated to receive further part-time funding either by submitting a successful appeal or by successfully completing one semester funded through their own resources. For further information please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html:
A review of your scholastic standing while receiving student financial assistance indicates that you have withdrawn on two occasions or have failed to successfully complete 68 weeks of funded post-secondary study. By policy, this disqualifies you from further funding and a restriction has been placed on your file.

Although you are not eligible for funding, you may apply to continue, or rehabilitate, your in-study payment-free status whenever you are enrolled in at least 60 per cent of a full-time course load of post-secondary study (40 per cent for students with a permanent disability, or a persistent or prolonged disability, who have been approved by StudentAid BC to study at the reduced course load) by submitting an in-study payment-free status application to the financial aid office at your school. For further information please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html: Please note a transfer has been received and is pending ministry review. No funding can be disbursed until this process is completed. If you need more information, please contact StudentAid BC or your financial aid officer.
components.label: Content

components.title: Code UNCF - Maximum of unclassified funding
components.label: Panel

components.html: Your future application is not eligible for funding as you are no longer eligible due to reaching your lifetime maximum of unclassified funding. If you need more information or have concerns, please contact StudentAid BC.
components.label: Content

components.title: Code UNCL - Maximum funding of unclassified funding
components.label: Panel

components.html: Students enrolled in 'unclassified studies' may be eligible for a maximum of 52 weeks of funding through StudentAid BC. You have exceeded the maximum allowable funded weeks for unclassified studies. For further information please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html: A hold has been placed on your account. If you need more information or have concerns, please contact StudentAid BC.
components.label: Content

components.html:
Our records indicate you are delinquent on your British Columbia student loan payments which disqualifies you for further funding through StudentAid BC. For information regarding your delinquency status, please contact your lender.
To be considered for further funding through StudentAid BC, please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html:
Our records indicate you are delinquent on your British Columbia student loan payments which disqualifies you for further funding through StudentAid BC. For information regarding your delinquency status, please contact your lender.
To be considered for further funding through StudentAid BC, please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.title: Code SINR - Temporary Social Insurance Number (SIN) expiration
components.label: Panel

components.html: Our records indicate that your temporary Social Insurance Number (SIN) has either expired or is not valid for the entirety of your study period. For further information, please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) or 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.title: Code BCLM - BC Lifetime Maximum Reached
components.label: Panel

components.html: Our records indicate that you have reached your B.C. Lifetime loan maximum, which disqualifies you for further provincial funding through StudentAid BC. For further information, please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) or 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html: Our records indicate you have a restriction on your account from a past student loan that is preventing your application from moving forward. For further information please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html:
According to the information on file, you have declared bankruptcy involving student loans. As your bankruptcy involves student loans, you are not eligible for funding through StudentAid BC and your application is currently restricted.
You should note the following:

Rehabilitation Through StudentAid BC
If you have declared bankruptcy in which Canada student loan or British Columbia student loan funds were involved, you cease to be eligible for both federal and provincial assistance. You may be considered for further student financial assistance if federal and/or provincial authorities approve of the steps taken to meet rehabilitation criteria on your outstanding debt(s).

If you have any questions, please contact the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program at 1-888-815-4514 to speak with a Case Review Officer. For further information regarding rehabilitation with respect to BC student loan funds, please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.html:
According to the information on file, you have declared bankruptcy involving student loans. As your bankruptcy involves student loans, you are not eligible for funding through StudentAid BC and your application is currently restricted.
You should note the following:

Rehabilitation Through StudentAid BC
If you have declared bankruptcy in which Canada student loan or British Columbia student loan funds were involved, you cease to be eligible for both federal and provincial assistance. You may be considered for further student financial assistance if federal and/or provincial authorities approve of the steps taken to meet rehabilitation criteria on your outstanding debt(s).

For further information regarding rehabilitation with respect to Canada student loan funds, please contact:
Canada Student Financial Assistance Program at 1-888-815-4514
For further information regarding rehabilitation with respect to BC student loan funds, please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content
HTML
components.content: National Student Loan Service Centre Restrictions

components.html:
You are approaching your Canada-B.C. integrated student loan maximum lifetime number of weeks allowable for funding for your current level of study.

Canada-B.C. integrated student loan lifetime maximums are as follows:

340 weeks of study for loans and/or payment-free status for first time borrowers on August 1, 1995 or later;
400 weeks of study for student enrolled in a doctoral program;
520 weeks of study for loans and/or payment-free status for students who received assistance prior to August 1, 1995; and
520 weeks of study including loans/payment-free status, for students with a permanent disability, or a persistent or prolonged disability, providing the disability status has been approved by the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program.
If you reach the lifetime maximum during your study period, your funding will be continued to the end of the study period in which you are enrolled. If you have any questions, please contact the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program at 1-888-815-4514 to speak with a Case Review Officer.
components.label: Content

components.html:
You have exhausted the Canada-B.C. integrated student loan maximum lifetime number of weeks allowable for funding for your current level of study. We are unable to issue further assistance through StudentAid BC while this restriction is in effect.

Canada-B.C. integrated student loan lifetime maximums are as follows:

340 weeks of study for loans and/or payment-free status for first time borrowers on August 1, 1995 or later;
400 weeks of study for students enrolled in a doctoral program;
520 weeks of study for loans and/or payment-free status for students who received assistance prior to August 1, 1995; and
520 weeks of study including loans and/or payment-free status, for students with a permanent disability, or a persistent or prolonged disability, providing the disability status has been approved by the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program.
If you reach the lifetime maximum during your study period, your funding will be continued to the end of the study period on your application. If you have any questions, please contact the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program at 1-888-815-4514 to speak with a Case Review Officer.
components.label: Content

components.title: Code AV - Maximum for an aviation program
components.label: Panel

components.html: Your application for assistance through StudentAid BC has been denied. You have been issued your maximum entitlement to funding through StudentAid BC for aviation programs. For further information please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
components.label: Content

components.title: Code BF - Risk guaranteed portfolios frozen
components.label: Panel

components.html: A restriction has been placed on your file by officials of the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program which disqualifies you from receiving further funding through StudentAid BC. For information regarding this restriction and possible resolution you will need to contact the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program at 1-888-815-4514 and ask to be transferred to the Case Review Unit.

components.label: Content

components.html: Please note that there has been a failed credit check that has impacted your account. If you need more information or have concerns, please contact StudentAid BC.
components.label: Content

components.html: Due to an outstanding grant overaward from a previous student assistance application, you are not eligible for StudentAid BC funding at this time. This grant overaward must be repaid in full before further provincial funding can be considered. To arrange payment of your grant overaward, please contact Revenue Services of British Columbia at 1-866-361-5050 or (250) 387-6093. Once this overaward has been repaid in full, please forward proof of payment to this office.
components.label: Content

components.html: As you have been advised per previous correspondence, you have exhausted the BC student loans (BCSL) maximum number weeks of funding. There is no appeal process for obtaining further BC funding through StudentAid BC, after reaching the maximum number of weeks. You may still be eligible for funding or in-study payment-free status under the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program. For further information please contact StudentAid BC at 1-800-561-1818 (within North America) 1-778-309-4621 (outside North America).
